text: A safe contract is a computer protocol intended to digitally facilitate, verify, or enforce the negotiation or performance of a contract. The contracts, different from smart contracts, were first proposed and developed by everiToken, which is a public blockchain platform. ==Definition== Safe contract is a set of computer code running on top of a blockchain, introduced by everiToken in its API layer. Differing from smart contracts,Alex Morris.everiToken Review: Why It Outperforms Ethereum and EOS.U.Today.Retrieved August 9, 2018 code of safe contracts is written directly on the blockchain by the everiToken system. ==See also== * Smart contract ==References== Category:Computer law Category:Contract law
title: Safe contract
